page.title: 16SESSAY - ARTS AND CRAFTS
page.content: There is a very lively interest in all manner of{arts and crafts}in Sessay. Many of the women knit and sew, but we have one or two outstanding embroider- esses. Living in such lovely scenery has encouraged artists to paint and photograph, and one man makes wrought iron and carves in wood. Some of the old{country crafts}are still practised - corn dollies, spinning and weaving: one spinner makes the lovely spinning wheels. Crafts taught at the village {evening class}are legion and include upholstery, soft furnishing, quilting, patchwork, and pewter work. Naturally we have a{village show}where all these crafts can be exhibited along with garden produce and flowers and the work of the flower arrangers. The {Drama Group}puts on two shows a year which have become a part of the village life.
